briefdescription.para: Macro for creating a PWM driver instance.

memberdef.name: NRFX_PWM_DEFAULT_CONFIG
memberdef.initializer: { \ .output_pins = { \ _out_0, \ _out_1, \ _out_2, \ _out_3, \ }, \ .pin_inverted = { \ false, \ false, \ false, \ false, \ }, \ .irq_priority = NRFX_PWM_DEFAULT_CONFIG_IRQ_PRIORITY, \ .base_clock = NRF_PWM_CLK_1MHz, \ .count_mode = NRF_PWM_MODE_UP, \ .top_value = 1000, \ .load_mode = NRF_PWM_LOAD_COMMON, \ .step_mode = NRF_PWM_STEP_AUTO, \ .skip_gpio_cfg = false \ }

briefdescription.para: PWM driver default configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
This configuration sets up PWM with the following options:
clock frequency: 1 MHz
count up
top value: 1000 clock ticks
load mode: common
step mode: auto

parameterdescription.para: PWM output 0 pin.
PWM output 1 pin.
PWM output 2 pin.
PWM output 3 pin.

briefdescription.para: Macro returning PWM interrupt handler.

detaileddescription.para:
When the requested playback is finished, the peripheral will be stopped.
The STOP task is triggered when the last value of the final sequence is loaded from RAM, and the peripheral stops at the end of the current PWM period. For sequences with configured repeating of duty cycle values, this might result in less than the requested number of repeats of the last value.

When the requested playback is finished, it will be started from the beginning. This flag is ignored if used together with NRFX_PWM_FLAG_STOP.
The playback restart is done via a shortcut configured in the PWM peripheral. This shortcut triggers the proper starting task when the final value of previous playback is read from RAM and applied to the pulse generator counter. When this mechanism is used together with the NRF_PWM_STEP_TRIGGERED mode, the playback restart will occur right after switching to the final value (this final value will be played only once).
The event handler is to be called when the last value from sequence 0 is loaded.
The event handler is to be called when the last value from sequence 1 is loaded.
The playback finished event (enabled by default) is to be suppressed.
The playback must not be started directly by the called function. Instead, the function must only prepare it and return the address of the task to be triggered to start the playback.

briefdescription.para: PWM flags providing additional playback options.
Sequence playback finished.

detaileddescription.para: End of sequence 0 reached. Its data can be safely modified now.
End of sequence 1 reached. Its data can be safely modified now.

briefdescription.para: The PWM peripheral has been stopped.
PWM driver event type.
PWM driver event handler type.

memberdef.argsstring: (nrfx_pwm_t const *p_instance, nrfx_pwm_config_t const *p_config, nrfx_pwm_handler_t handler, void *p_context)
memberdef.name: nrfx_pwm_init

briefdescription.para: Function for initializing the PWM driver.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the structure with the initial configuration. NULL if configuration is to be skipped and will be done later using nrfx_pwm_reconfigure.
Event handler provided by the user. If NULL is passed instead, event notifications are not done and PWM interrupts are disabled.
Context passed to the event handler.
Initialization was successful.
The driver is already initialized.
The driver is already initialized. Deprecated - use NRFX_ERROR_ALREADY instead.

briefdescription.para: Function for reconfiguring the PWM driver.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the structure with the configuration.
Reconfiguration was successful.
The driver is during playback.
The driver is uninitialized.

briefdescription.para: Function for uninitializing the PWM driver.

detaileddescription.para: If any sequence playback is in progress, it is stopped immediately.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the PWM driver instance is initialized.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Instance is already initialized.

memberdef.argsstring: (nrfx_pwm_t const *p_instance, nrf_pwm_sequence_t const *p_sequence, uint16_t playback_count, uint32_t flags)
memberdef.name: nrfx_pwm_simple_playback

briefdescription.para: Function for starting a single sequence playback.

detaileddescription.para: To take advantage of the looping mechanism in the PWM peripheral, both sequences must be used (single sequence can be played back only once by the peripheral). Therefore, the provided sequence is internally set and played back as both sequence 0 and sequence 1. Consequently, if the end of sequence notifications are required, events for both sequences must be used (that is, both the NRFX_PWM_FLAG_SIGNAL_END_SEQ0 flag and the NRFX_PWM_FLAG_SIGNAL_END_SEQ1 flag must be specified, and the NRFX_PWM_EVT_END_SEQ0 event and the NRFX_PWM_EVT_END_SEQ1 event must be handled in the same way).

Use the NRFX_PWM_FLAG_START_VIA_TASK flag if you want the playback to be only prepared by this function, and you want to start it later by triggering a task (for example, by using PPI). The function will then return the address of the task to be triggered.

simplesect.para: The array containing the duty cycle values for the specified sequence must be in RAM and cannot be allocated on the stack. For detailed information, see nrf_pwm_sequence_t.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Sequence to be played back.
Number of playbacks to be performed (must not be 0).
Additional options. Pass any combination of playback flags, or 0 for default settings.

simplesect.para: Address of the task to be triggered to start the playback if the NRFX_PWM_FLAG_START_VIA_TASK flag was used, 0 otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (nrfx_pwm_t const *p_instance, nrf_pwm_sequence_t const *p_sequence_0, nrf_pwm_sequence_t const *p_sequence_1, uint16_t playback_count, uint32_t flags)
memberdef.name: nrfx_pwm_complex_playback

briefdescription.para: Function for starting a two-sequence playback.

detaileddescription.para: Use the NRFX_PWM_FLAG_START_VIA_TASK flag if you want the playback to be only prepared by this function, and you want to start it later by triggering a task (using PPI for instance). The function will then return the address of the task to be triggered.

simplesect.para: The array containing the duty cycle values for the specified sequence must be in RAM and cannot be allocated on the stack. For detailed information, see nrf_pwm_sequence_t.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
First sequence to be played back.
Second sequence to be played back.
Number of playbacks to be performed (must not be 0).
Additional options. Pass any combination of playback flags, or 0 for default settings.

simplesect.para: Address of the task to be triggered to start the playback if the NRFX_PWM_FLAG_START_VIA_TASK flag was used, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Function for advancing the active sequence.

detaileddescription.para: This function only applies to NRF_PWM_STEP_TRIGGERED mode.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for stopping the sequence playback.

detaileddescription.para: The playback is stopped at the end of the current PWM period. This means that if the active sequence is configured to repeat each duty cycle value for a certain number of PWM periods, the last played value might appear on the output less times than requested.

simplesect.para: This function can be instructed to wait until the playback is stopped (by setting wait_until_stopped to true). Depending on the length of the PMW period, this might take a significant amount of time. Alternatively, the nrfx_pwm_stopped_check function can be used to poll the status, or the NRFX_PWM_EVT_STOPPED event can be used to get the notification when the playback is stopped, provided the event handler is defined.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
If true, the function will not return until the playback is stopped.
The PWM peripheral is stopped.
The PWM peripheral is not stopped.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking the status of the PWM peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
The PWM peripheral is stopped.
The PWM peripheral is not stopped.

briefdescription.para: Function for updating the sequence data during playback.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Identifier of the sequence (0 or 1).
Pointer to the new sequence definition.

briefdescription.para: Function for returning the address of a specified PWM task that can be used in PPI module.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Requested task.

briefdescription.para: Function for returning the address of a specified PWM event that can be used in PPI module.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
